description: Ms. codex. Title from beginning of text (fol. 1b, l. 24-25). The name of the author appears at the beginning of the text as: "al-Sayyid Sharaf al-Dīn ibn Ṣalāḥ ibn al-Qāsim ibn Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAlī ibn al-Imām Sharaf al-Dīn ibn Ṣalāḥ al-Kawkabānī baladan al-Zaydī madhhaban" (fol. 1b, l. 12-14). The introduction (fol. 1b-2b) is written in 27 lines per page; table on fol. 3a; tables 5 x 4 on fol. 3b-5a; tables 1 x 13 on fol. 5b-25a. Fol. 25b-26b have been framed but left blank. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Frames in red ink. European glazed paper with watermark. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Collation: Paper ; fol. 26 ; 1-2¹⁰ 3⁶ ; catchword on some leaves. For a description of the content, see W. Ahlwardt. Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, no. 4237. Incipit: بسم ... وصلى الله ... وسلم الحمد لله الذى اطلع بدور الارادات فى فلك السعادات وظهر ... القران ترتيلا وبعد فيقول الفقير ... هذا كتاب محكم النظم قريب الفهم محروس القواعد Explicit: يصل رسول ليلة الاثنين او يوم الخميس ولكنه ليس بمصلح فانه عدو حسود
author: Kawkabānī, Sharaf al-Dīn ibn Ṣalāḥ, active 17th century
abstract: Work on divination in forty tables.
extent: 26 leaves, ill. : paper ; 212 x 152 (167 x 104) mm.
title: Sahm al-ghayb fī ikhrāj al-ḍamīr bi-lā rayb
provenance: Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900, from the books of Amīn ibn al-Ḥasan al-Ḥulwānī al-Madanī al-Ḥanafī (Medina).
creator: كوكباني، شرف الدين بن صلاح
subject: Divination—Religious aspects—Islam—Early works to 1800
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
